etymologies: Middle English: probably of Scandinavian origin; compare with Icelandic mýrisnípa; obscurely related to Dutch snip and German Schnepfe

crossReferenceMarkers: See also painted snipe, seed snipe
definitions: a wading bird of marshes and wet meadows, with brown camouflaged plumage, a long straight bill, and typically a drumming display flight.

notes.text: Gallinago and other genera, family Scolopacidae: several species, e.g. the common snipe (G. gallinago)

shortDefinitions: wading bird of marshes and wet meadows, with brown camouflaged plumage, long straight bill

definitions: shoot at someone from a hiding place, especially accurately and at long range

examples.text: the soldiers in the trench sniped at us

shortDefinitions: shoot at someone from hiding place

definitions: make a sly or petty verbal attack

examples.text: the state governor constantly sniped at the president

shortDefinitions: make sly or petty verbal attack

definitions: (in an online auction) place a bid judged to be high enough to win an item just before the bidding is scheduled to close

examples.text: I regularly snipe 10 to 5 seconds before the end of eBay auctions

shortDefinitions: (in online auction) place bid just before bidding is scheduled to close

definitions: outbid (another bidder in an online auction) just before the bidding is scheduled to close

examples.text: what is the point of sitting around for a seven-day auction when half the time you get sniped at the last second

shortDefinitions: outbid another bidder in online auction just before bidding is scheduled to close
